item.title: Onimusha: Way of the Sword New Trailer Provides First Look At Gameplay
item.content:encoded:
https://wccftech.com/onimusha-way-of-the-sword-gameplay/

The first look at the Onimusha: Way of the Sword gameplay has finally arrived with a new trailer shown during the latest State of Play presentation.

The trailer, which can be watched below, introduces the new main character, the renowned Miyamoto Musashi, as he fights his way through some zombie samurai using his sword and taking advantage of the environment. The grounded combat system, in particular, feels like a welcome change over the vast majority of modern action games featuring over-the-top elements and looks markedly Onimusha. Hopefully, during the course of the adventure, we will be able to employ the Niten Ichi-ryū combat style that Musashi created and perfected during his life that was absent from this initial gameplay showcase.

Besides featuring a new Onimusha: Way of the Sword trailer, yesterday's State of Play presentation also featured a new Onimusha 2: Samurai's Destiny trailer which provided another look at the recently announced remaster of the second entry in the CAPCOM series. You can check out Jubei Yaguy in action with higher resolution graphics and other visual improvements below.

Onimusha: Way of the Sword launches sometime in 2026 on PC, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X and Xbox Series S.

item.title: Stellar Blade Launches on PC this June; New DLC Confirmed
item.content:encoded:
https://wccftech.com/stellar-blade-pc-june/

Over a year after its debut on PC, Shift Up's Stellar Blade will finally release on PC in a few months, alongside new DLC.

During yesterday's State of Play presentation, the Korean studio confirmed that the action game will launch on PC this June. Following the announcement, the game's Steam store page also went live, but it sadly did not reveal any additional information on the PC version or the system requirements.

As already mentioned, the PC version of Stellar Blade will be accompanied by the launch of a new GODDESS OF VICTORY: NIKKE DLC, which, much like the NieR Automata DLC released last year, will bring two different franchises together in an explosive collaboration. You can check out the new DLC in action in the trailer below.

Stellar Blade is now available on PlayStation 5 and will launch on PC this June. You can learn more about the excellent action game by Shift Up in our review.

No butts about it, Stellar Blade is a marvelous feast for the eyes and a technically impressive action RPG. Those who find the hyper-sexualized Eve offputting will find little redemption in finding some modesty for the playable heroine, but at the same time, those already accustomed to the years following Bayonetta’s release and 2Booty memes will find the character designs enjoyable, to say the least. Stellar Blade is a fantastic action title, and one PlayStation exclusive you’ll have to play after the kids go to bed.

item.title: PlayStation 5 Has Sold 75 Million Units; Death Stranding 2, Ghost of Yotei Are Still Scheduled For a 2025 Release
item.content:encoded:
https://wccftech.com/playstation-5-sold-75-million-units/

The PlayStation 5 is doing great on the market and has sold an impressive number of units in the past quarter, bringing its total units sold well past the 60 million units point.

In Sony's latest financial report covering the third quarter of the current fiscal year, it has been confirmed that the PlayStation 5 had its best quarter to date in terms of sales, having sold 9.5 million units, bringing the total of units sold to 75 million. In terms of software sales, Sony reported 96 million units sold, a solid increase over the 89.7 million units sold during the third quarter of the previous fiscal year. Both hardware and software sales contributed to the record operating profits in the third quarter of the year.

In terms of user engagement, the PlayStation 5 is also doing quite well. 42% of new console purchases have come from new users, bringing the total number of active users to 129 million users, which Sony is looking to increase further by diversifying its lineup with family and live service games. Regarding new releases, it was confirmed that both Ghost of Yotei and Death Stranding 2: On the Beach are still scheduled for a 2025 release, which is definitely reassuring, considering both did not make an appearance during yesterday's State of Play presentation.

The full detailed report, which goes over other Sony business segments besides PlayStation, can be found here.
